revised_title: John Herbert Parsons: A Pioneering Ophthalmologist and Visionary
tldr: John Herbert Parsons was a renowned ophthalmologist who made significant contributions to the field of ophthalmology and vision science. He focused on understanding the physiology and biochemistry of the eye, and his research on the vascular control of intraocular pressure and the psychology of vision helped shape the future of ophthalmology. Parsons also played a crucial role in promoting visual hygiene and the study of color vision, as well as the broader field of sensory perception.
